title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview is virtual. Start pay is 16 dollars more for experience. And more if your a college graduate. They do background checks before job offer and process is fast. This is one of the better jobs in this field.
Interview Questions: Your different scenario on helping individuals.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward and the interviewer was very informational. You go through a background check and drug test before being hired. Once hired, you have to complete two weeks paid training with computer lessons. You go through a few days of on the job training and then you start the role.
Interview Questions: What does it mean to you to be an advocate for someone?

title: Direct Care Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Virtual. Hired after interview.  interviewer was kind and informative about the company .  She  asked applicable questions and  gave honest  opinions .  It was an interactive interview and  she was very welcoming
Interview Questions: Asked what I would do in various situations.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fair and nonjudgmental.  It was a single interview with your to be supervisor. It was a relaxed environment. By the end of the interview, I knew I had gotten a job.
Interview Questions: General questions about experience in home health and working with the IDD population.

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Interview Descriptions: A few scenario questions. Mostly asks about previous experience and how you would handle certain situations moving forward. Also, asks some basic interview questions as well. The whole  process was only an application and one interview.
Interview Questions: What are two strengths you feel that would fit with this job?

title: DSP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Apply on line and interview with HR and direct managing staff.Once hired you must go through a mandatory payed week of orientation and training which they have a great team to give you every tool you will need to work with residents who reside in there wonderful homes.
Interview Questions: Have I ever worked in this field?

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Phila, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a phone call within 3 days. The interview process was fairly simple, I met with my current supervisor and Human Resources representative. After the portion of the interview with my supervisor was completed, I was offered the position on the spot and I accepted.
Interview Questions: Why do you think advocacy is such an important part of your job for the people we support?

title: Lead DSP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not bad. It was a one on one interview, and it was focus on the individual you will be taking care of. the interviewer give a n  and asked what I would do if I was in such environment. She asked how was I going to meet the goal of the individuals I would be taken care of.
Interview Questions: What will you do, when you notice an error.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a temporary HR employee as the first part of the interview process. The employee made me feel comfortable and he was very friendly and compassionate. He felt good about hiring me and also advised me about what the department was looking for and that they would most likely hire me. I then interviewed with my direct supervisor who was also very friendly and kind. Then a few days later I got called back for a panel interview with other members of the department I had applied for.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with Autism?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: We only talked about different things about what I like and don't like, After filling out the application they hired me on the spot as an intern. I loved it!
Interview Questions: What do like about the company?

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SPIN, Inc. (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: You will interview with the director of the home you will be working in. They will ask you about your experience working in this field. Tell you about the individuals you will be supporting. Then they will explain the process ; prepared for a week 2 week training process; you will be certified in first aid, cpr and safety. They prepare you for working in the homes. Spin is very strict when it comes to time and attendance. Don't fall asleep and always be prepared.
Interview Questions: Explain a difficult situation working with people with IDD
